verses.verse: וְאַתָּה֙ <S%H859><s%> ve-'at-Tah you שָׂ֣א <S%H5375><s%> sa Moreover take thou up קִינָ֔ה <S%H7015><s%> ki-Nah, a lamentation אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- for נְשִׂיאֵ֖י <S%H5387><s%> ne-si-'Ei for the princes יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ <S%H3478><s%> Yis-ra-'El. of Israel

וְאָמַרְתָּ֗ <S%H559><s%> ve-'a-mar-Ta, And say מָ֤ה <S%H4100><s%> mah What אִמְּךָ֙ <S%H517><s%> 'im-me-Cha your mother לְבִיָּ֔א <S%H3833><s%> le-vi-Ya, great בֵּ֥ין <S%H996><s%> bein among אֲרָי֖וֹת <S%H738><s%> a-ra-Yot among lions רָבָ֑צָה <S%H7257><s%> ra-Va-tzah; she lay down בְּת֥וֹךְ <S%H8432><s%> be-Toch among כְּפִרִ֖ים <S%H3715><s%> ke-fi-Rim young lions רִבְּתָ֥ה <S%H7235><s%> rib-be-Tah she nourished גוּרֶֽיהָ׃ <S%H1482><s%> gu-Rei-ha. her whelps

וַתַּ֛עַל <S%H5927><s%> vat-Ta-'al And she brought up אֶחָ֥ד <S%H259><s%> 'e-Chad one מִגֻּרֶ֖יהָ <S%H1482><s%> mig-gu-Rei-ha of her whelps כְּפִ֣יר <S%H3715><s%> ke-Fir it became a young lion הָיָ֑ה <S%H1961><s%> ha-Yah; became וַיִּלְמַ֥ד <S%H3925><s%> vai-yil-Mad and it learned לִטְרָף־ <S%H2963><s%> lit-rof- to catch טֶ֖רֶף <S%H2964><s%> Te-ref the prey אָדָ֥ם <S%H120><s%> 'a-Dam men אָכָֽל׃ <S%H398><s%> 'a-Chal. it devoured

וַיִּשְׁמְע֥וּ <S%H8085><s%> vai-yish-me-'U also heard אֵלָ֛יו <S%H413><s%> 'e-Lav about גּוֹיִ֖ם <S%H1471><s%> go-Yim The nations בְּשַׁחְתָּ֣ם <S%H7845><s%> be-shach-Tam in their pit נִתְפָּ֑שׂ <S%H8610><s%> nit-Pas; of him he was taken וַיְבִאֻ֥הוּ <S%H935><s%> vay-vi-'U-hu and they brought בַֽחַחִ֖ים <S%H2397><s%> va-cha-Chim him with chains אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- about אֶ֥רֶץ <S%H776><s%> 'E-retz unto the land מִצְרָֽיִם׃ <S%H4714><s%> mitz-Ra-yim. of Egypt

וַתֵּ֙רֶא֙ <S%H7200><s%> vat-Te-re Now when she saw כִּ֣י <S%H3588><s%> ki for נֽוֹחֲלָ֔ה <S%H3176><s%> no-cha-Lah, that she had waited אָבְדָ֖ה <S%H6><s%> 'a-ve-Dah was lost תִּקְוָתָ֑הּ <S%H8615><s%> tik-va-Tah; [and] her hope וַתִּקַּ֛ח <S%H3947><s%> vat-tik-Kach then she took אֶחָ֥ד <S%H259><s%> 'e-Chad another מִגֻּרֶ֖יהָ <S%H1482><s%> mig-gu-Rei-ha of her whelps כְּפִ֥יר <S%H3715><s%> ke-Fir him a young lion שָׂמָֽתְהוּ׃ <S%H7760><s%> sa-Ma-te-hu. [and] made

וַיִּתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ <S%H1980><s%> vai-yit-hal-Lech And he went up and down בְּתוֹךְ־ <S%H8432><s%> be-toch- among אֲרָי֖וֹת <S%H738><s%> a-ra-Yot the lions כְּפִ֣יר <S%H3715><s%> ke-Fir he became a young lion הָיָ֑ה <S%H1961><s%> ha-Yah; became וַיִּלְמַ֥ד <S%H3925><s%> vai-yil-Mad and learned לִטְרָף־ <S%H2963><s%> lit-rof- to catch טֶ֖רֶף <S%H2964><s%> Te-ref the prey אָדָ֥ם <S%H120><s%> 'a-Dam men אָכָֽל׃ <S%H398><s%> 'a-Chal. [and] devoured

וַיֵּ֙דַע֙ <S%H3045><s%> vai-Ye-da' And he knew אַלְמְנוֹתָ֔יו <S%H490><s%> al-me-no-Tav, their desolate palaces וְעָרֵיהֶ֖ם <S%H5892><s%> ve-'a-rei-Hem their cities הֶחֱרִ֑יב <S%H2717><s%> he-che-Riv; and he laid waste וַתֵּ֤שַׁם <S%H3456><s%> vat-Te-sham was desolate אֶ֙רֶץ֙ <S%H776><s%> 'e-retz and the land וּמְלֹאָ֔הּ <S%H4393><s%> u-me-lo-'Ah, and the fulness מִקּ֖וֹל <S%H6963><s%> mik-Kol thereof by the noise שַׁאֲגָתֽוֹ׃ <S%H7581><s%> sha-'a-ga-To. of his roaring

וַיִּתְּנ֨וּ <S%H5414><s%> vai-yit-te-Nu set עָלָ֥יו <S%H5921><s%> 'a-Lav against גּוֹיִ֛ם <S%H1471><s%> go-Yim Then the nations סָבִ֖יב <S%H5439><s%> sa-Viv against him on every side מִמְּדִינ֑וֹת <S%H4082><s%> mi-me-di-Not; from the provinces וַֽיִּפְרְשׂ֥וּ <S%H6566><s%> vai-yif-re-Su and spread עָלָ֛יו <S%H5921><s%> 'a-Lav over רִשְׁתָּ֖ם <S%H7568><s%> rish-Tam their net בְּשַׁחְתָּ֥ם <S%H7845><s%> be-shach-Tam in their pit נִתְפָּֽשׂ׃ <S%H8610><s%> nit-Pas. over him he was taken

וַֽיִּתְּנֻ֤הוּ <S%H5414><s%> vai-yit-te-Nu-hu And they put בַסּוּגַר֙ <S%H5474><s%> vas-su-Gar him in ward בַּֽחַחִ֔ים <S%H2397><s%> ba-cha-Chim, in chains וַיְבִאֻ֖הוּ <S%H935><s%> vay-vi-'U-hu and brought אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to מֶ֣לֶךְ <S%H4428><s%> Me-lech him to the king בָּבֶ֑ל <S%H894><s%> ba-Vel; of Babylon יְבִאֻ֙הוּ֙ <S%H935><s%> ye-vi-'U-hu they brought בַּמְּצֹד֔וֹת <S%H4686><s%> bam-me-tzo-Dot, castle לְמַ֗עַן <S%H4616><s%> le-Ma-'an, So לֹא־ <S%H3808><s%> lo- no יִשָּׁמַ֥ע <S%H8085><s%> yish-sha-Ma' should no more be heard קוֹל֛וֹ <S%H6963><s%> ko-Lo that his voice ע֖וֹד <S%H5750><s%> od more אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- on הָרֵ֥י <S%H2022><s%> ha-Rei upon the mountains יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ <S%H3478><s%> Yis-ra-'El. of Israel פ Peh

אִמְּךָ֥ <S%H517><s%> 'im-me-Cha Thy mother כַגֶּ֛פֶן <S%H1612><s%> chag-Ge-fen [is] like a vine בְּדָמְךָ֖ <S%H1818><s%> be-da-me-Cha bloodshed עַל־ <S%H5921><s%> 'al- by מַ֣יִם <S%H4325><s%> Ma-yim by the waters שְׁתוּלָ֑ה <S%H8362><s%> she-tu-Lah; planted פֹּֽרִיָּה֙ <S%H6509><s%> po-ri-Yah she was fruitful וַֽעֲנֵפָ֔ה <S%H6058><s%> va-'a-ne-Fah, and full of branches הָיְתָ֖ה <S%H1961><s%> ha-ye-Tah become מִמַּ֥יִם <S%H4325><s%> mi-Ma-yim waters רַבִּֽים׃ <S%H7227><s%> rab-Bim. by reason of many

וַיִּֽהְיוּ־ <S%H1961><s%> vai-yih-yu- had לָ֞הּ lah מַטּ֣וֹת <S%H4294><s%> mat-Tot rods עֹ֗ז <S%H5797><s%> 'Oz, And she had strong אֶל־ <S%H413><s%> 'el- to שִׁבְטֵי֙ <S%H7626><s%> shiv-Tei for the sceptres מֹֽשְׁלִ֔ים <S%H4910><s%> mo-she-Lim, of them that bare rule וַתִּגְבַּ֥הּ <S%H1361><s%> vat-tig-Bah was exalted קֽוֹמָת֖וֹ <S%H6967><s%> ko-ma-To and her stature עַל־ <S%H5921><s%> 'al- and בֵּ֣ין <S%H996><s%> bein among עֲבֹתִ֑ים <S%H5688><s%> 'a-vo-Tim; among the thick branches וַיֵּרָ֣א <S%H7200><s%> vai-ye-Ra and she appeared בְגָבְה֔וֹ <S%H1363><s%> ve-ga-ve-Ho, in her height בְּרֹ֖ב <S%H7230><s%> be-Ro with the multitude דָּלִיֹּתָֽיו׃ <S%H1808><s%> da-li-yo-Tav. of her branches

וַתֻּתַּ֤שׁ <S%H5428><s%> vat-tut-Tash But she was plucked up בְּחֵמָה֙ <S%H2534><s%> be-che-Mah in fury לָאָ֣רֶץ <S%H776><s%> la-'A-retz to the ground הֻשְׁלָ֔כָה <S%H7993><s%> hush-La-chah, she was cast down וְר֥וּחַ <S%H7307><s%> ve-Ru-ach wind הַקָּדִ֖ים <S%H6921><s%> hak-ka-Dim and the east הוֹבִ֣ישׁ <S%H3001><s%> ho-Vish dried up פִּרְיָ֑הּ <S%H6529><s%> pir-Yah; her fruit הִתְפָּרְק֧וּ <S%H6561><s%> hit-pa-re-Ku were broken וְיָבֵ֛שׁוּ <S%H3001><s%> ve-ya-Ve-shu and withered מַטֵּ֥ה <S%H4294><s%> mat-Teh rods עֻזָּ֖הּ <S%H5797><s%> 'uz-Zah her strong אֵ֥שׁ <S%H784><s%> 'esh the fire אֲכָלָֽתְהוּ׃ <S%H398><s%> 'a-cha-La-te-hu. consumed

וְעַתָּ֖ה <S%H6258><s%> ve-'at-Tah and now שְׁתוּלָ֣ה <S%H8362><s%> she-tu-Lah And now she [is] planted בַמִּדְבָּ֑ר <S%H4057><s%> vam-mid-Bar; in the wilderness בְּאֶ֖רֶץ <S%H776><s%> be-'E-retz ground צִיָּ֥ה <S%H6723><s%> tzi-Yah in a dry וְצָמָֽא׃ <S%H6772><s%> ve-tza-Ma. and thirsty

וַתֵּצֵ֨א <S%H3318><s%> vat-te-Tze is gone out אֵ֜שׁ <S%H784><s%> 'esh And fire מִמַּטֵּ֤ה <S%H4294><s%> mi-mat-Teh of a rod בַדֶּ֙יהָ֙ <S%H905><s%> vad-Dei-ha of her branches פִּרְיָ֣הּ <S%H6529><s%> pir-Yah her fruit אָכָ֔לָה <S%H398><s%> 'a-Cha-lah, [which] hath devoured וְלֹא־ <S%H3808><s%> ve-lo- and has הָ֥יָה <S%H1961><s%> Ha-yah become בָ֛הּ vah מַטֵּה־ <S%H4294><s%> mat-teh- rod עֹ֖ז <S%H5797><s%> 'oz so that she hath no strong שֵׁ֣בֶט <S%H7626><s%> She-vet [to be] a sceptre לִמְשׁ֑וֹל <S%H4910><s%> lim-Shol; to rule קִ֥ינָה <S%H7015><s%> Ki-nah This [is] a lamentation הִ֖יא <S%H1931><s%> hi he וַתְּהִ֥י <S%H1961><s%> vat-te-Hi become לְקִינָֽה׃ <S%H7015><s%> le-ki-Nah. and shall be for a lamentation פ Peh
